title: Sesame Udon Noodles
instructions: Cook udon noodles according to package instructions until tender. Drain and rinse briefly, then toss with a little sesame oil to prevent sticking.
Prepare the sesame sauce: blend tahini, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, ginger, and a splash of water until smooth.
Slice the planted into thin strips. Stir-fry in a hot wok with vegetable oil until golden and slightly crispy, about 4 minutes.
Add the udon noodles to the wok along with sliced bell peppers and snap peas. Toss over high heat for 2 minutes.
Pour in the sesame sauce and toss everything together until noodles are evenly coated and heated through.
Transfer to serving bowls and top with toasted white and black sesame seeds, sliced scallions, and chili flakes if desired.
